intro: Fumana ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty fumana, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Fumana ferruginea is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
